name: Project template A (more)
description:
A project template to organize your design work and Figma pages.


Ever felt the pain of trying to navigate and find what you're looking for in someone else's design files?


This file template contains a suggested recipe for how to organize your Figma files, in an attempt to reduce this pain point. Think of following the recipe as a favour to your current and future colleagues.


How the template works

In the pages toolbar on the left within the file, you should see a structure with emojis followed by a description. Use the ones you need, you don‚Äôt have to use them all.


Sometimes you might even need to duplicate a page. For example, you might have several ‚ÄúExploration‚Äù pages. No problem! Just name them in a way that is clear, and add a date (eg. üéàExploration | Aug 2021) to make it easy to understand if something is recent or not.


Perhaps using a different page structure would work better for you! That‚Äôs ok! Do that. But now you are using a structure that everyone else can follow.


To get started, duplicate this entire Figma file, then change the duplicated file to suit your needs.
